comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: I dont think "Add Notes" is a good display name, nowhere else do we have a verb first e.g. we never have "Add First Name" etc. I would question this one, since "Add Notes" will display in view mode, when the user cant add anything, which makes no sense.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Why is the one above "Number of Collective Bargaining Entities" and this one "Number of CBA's" (they should be consistent, in my opinion). Check with Maura if this can be changed. Similarly, the validation message seems wrong for same reason.

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Why is maxLength in the JSP? This should be coming from the entity attribute. The point of this JIRA was to remove these from JSP?!

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment: Why is maxLength in the JSP? This should be coming from the entity attribute. The point of this JIRA was to remove these from JSP?!

comments.author: Sachin Jaybhay

comments.comment: Why is size and maxLength in the JSP? This should be coming from the entity attribute. The point of this JIRA was to remove these from JSP?!

comments.author: Killian Farrell
comments.comment:
Typical standard is to have the config names without spaces and in PascalCase
e.g. ShortName

comments.author: Killian Farrell
comments.comment:
suggest breaking out both parts of this into to two methods for readablitly
e.g. getTimeEntitlementAmount(selectedLeavePlan) getEntitlementAmountBasis(selectedLeavePlan)
return getTimeEntitlementAmount(selectedLeavePlan) + " " + getEntitlementAmountBasis(selectedLeavePlan);
not sure if should be using Stringbuilder here. Give other teams a shout to see how picky they are

comments.author: John McCosker
comments.comment: StringBuilder or StringBuffer is fine.

comments.author: Hugo Dias

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment: Replace all in code constants by private static final String

comments.author: Hugo Dias
comments.comment:
No need for a before method when there's only 1 test.
Also creating entities in the Before only if for all tests it won't have different behaviours. I prefer to have the creation of the entities in the test to make it easier to analyze.

This seems excessive, and its causing wrapping on the UI. The user knows they are in a leave plan, I dont see why we need "Leave Plan Effective Date" and "Leave Plan End Date". Please re-check with Maura and show her the UI in 1024*768 mode.
If we do this, why dont we have "Leave Plan" as a prefix for all fields?!
